message: I have a high-quality product worth $200, which is a great opportunity for you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, a 50% discount. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere. What do you say?
I'll take the offer, thank you!

I'm not interested in buying without knowing the quality of the product.

I'm not sure about this one, Alice. You're usually so confident in your products, but this one sounds a bit... unusual. I'll have to pass on this one.

I completely understand your hesitation earlier, and I apologize if my description didn't quite convey the value of that product. Let me make it up to you with this next one! I've got a top-of-the-line product that's a real showstopper. I'm offering it to you for $100, which is a steal considering its actual worth. Thank you for the apology, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to make it up to me. I'll take the offer and give your new product a chance.

I'm glad you gave me a second chance, Bob! Unfortunately, it looks like I've got a bit of a dud this time around. I'm not going to sugarcoat it - this product isn't my best work. I'm offering it to you for $100, but I'm not expecting you to be thrilled with it. If you do decide to buy it, I'll throw in a 'get out of one bad product' free pass - if you're not satisfied with this one, you can come back and I'll give you a new product of your choice, no questions asked.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I'm not going to take a chance on a product that's not your best work. I think I'll pass on this one.
